Drench'd by a fiercly beating show'r,</br>A NETTLE bent its foliage dank,</br>And whelming many a gaudy flow'r,</br>Shed ruin on its weedy bank:</br>The Primrose droop'd, the Cowslip died,</br>The victims of the rapid tide;</br>But, from a spot securely high,</br>A sturdy DAISY rais'd its ruby-lustred eye.

"Bold WEED!"  the monitor exclaim'd,</br>"Why art thou plac'd with flowerts sweet!</br>We are for fragrant graces fam'd,</br>The morning gales our beauties greet;</br>We scent the hedge-row's tangled side,</br>Our breathings o'er the mountains glide,</br>Our race enliven ev'ry scene,</br>And dapple, with bright tints, the meadow's sober green.

"We are the blushing maiden's pride,</br>The am'rous Carles our buds entwine;</br>We deck the blooming village-bride,</br>And strew LOVE'S consecrated shrine.</br>We meet the sun with lust'rous dyes,</br>In gardens gay exulting rise;</br>Bloom in the cultur'd paths of taste,</br>And glow, our sunny day, the sov'reigns of the waste.

"But THOU!  ill-favour'd, wandering weed!</br>What store of beauty dost thou bring?</br>Thou by the hand of fate decreed</br>To bear the agonizing sting.</br>Thy leaves no varied tints display,</br>The trav'ller shuns thee in his way,</br>The fearful infant dreads thy pow'r,</br>For wounding anguish lurks beneath thy sickly show'r."

The NETTLE, with indignant scorn,</br>Thus to the vaunting bud replied:</br>"'Tis true, unfavour'd was I born,</br>For Splendor all her charms denied;</br>I boast no golden, glossy hue,</br>No perfume bath'd in lucid dew,</br>No Sapphire lustre — Ruby glow—</br>As down my weeping leaves the tears of morning flow.

"I am unnoticed by the proud—</br>Left, on the hedge row wild, to fade,</br>Uncourted by the passing crowd,</br>Or buried in the darksome shade.</br>I see the meanest gaudy flow'r</br>Flaunt gayly thro' the sunny hour,</br>While I am scorn'd, and left to die,</br>The most neglected child of NATURE'S progeny!

"Then, wherefore wonder at my sting!</br>Can I, so humbled, prove serene?</br>Can I a grateful aspect bring,</br>Where nought but smiles of scorn, is seen.</br>Insulted, vex'd, denied to rear</br>My brow where gaudier buds appear;</br>Shun'd by the trav'ller passing by,</br>And left by empty PRIDE, on thorny wilds — to die!

"Vain DAISY!  well may'st thou be proud,</br>Thou art by all admir'd, caress'd!</br>Thou never see'st the scornful croud—</br>Shunning thy paths, by splendor drest.</br>Thou are not urg'd by wrongs, to pour</br>Resentment on each scoffing flow'r,</br>To dart the wounding sting at those,</br>Who chill, with cold contempt, thy pillow of repose.

"Know, 'tis NEGLECT'S pernicious pow'r</br>The finely-sensate soul alarms;</br>While MIS'RY'S long and stormy hours</br>The busy Demon VENGEANCE arms!</br>Repeated wrongs, and proud disdain,</br>The mildest, purest virtues stain,</br>While, by strong NATURE'S just command,</br>FATE gives the pow'rful sting, to meet OPPRESSION'S hand!</br>
